question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [Error Handling] At line 88-94, does ERateLimitExceeded provide enough information for callers to handle the error, or can it cause unexpected transaction failures? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Error Codes] [Error Handling] Are the error codes (EInvalidConfig=0, EInvalidTime=1, ERateLimitExceeded=2) distinct enough to diagnose issues, or can they be confused with other protocol errors? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [Accumulation] Can calling process_qty() with very small quantities many times bypass rate limits due to decimal precision loss in accumulation? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [Accumulation] At line 86, does add(cur_qty, qty) maintain sufficient precision when accumulating thousands of small transactions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: update_internal()] [Accumulation] When prev_qty is set to cur_qty at line 52, can accumulated rounding errors propagate across multiple windows? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Accumulation] Does the weighted sum at lines 76-79 accurately represent total outflow when both prev_qty and cur_qty contain many accumulated transactions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [DoS] Can an attacker intentionally consume all rate limit capacity by calling process_qty with max_outflow quantity, denying service to legitimate users? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: new_config()] [DoS] Can a malicious admin set window_duration to u64::MAX, effectively making the rate limiter never reset and permanently limiting outflows? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: update_internal()] [DoS] Can providing cur_time values that cause overflow in arithmetic operations at lines 48-61 trigger assertion failures, causing DoS? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: remaining_outflow()] [DoS] Can repeatedly calling remaining_outflow with future cur_time values cause excessive window transitions and state updates? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Module Integration] If rate_limiter is used to protect withdrawals in Volo Vault, can attackers bypass protection by using alternative withdrawal methods not protected by the rate limiter? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Module Integration] Can the rate limiter's public functions (new, new_config) be called by unauthorized parties to create parallel rate limiters with different configurations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Module Integration] If multiple rate limiters are used simultaneously with different window_durations, can attackers exploit timing differences to extract value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Module Integration] Does the rate limiter properly coordinate with Volo Vault's operation status transitions (normal/during operation/disabled) to prevent rate limit bypass during operations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Struct: RateLimiter] [Capabilities] With copy, drop, store abilities, can rate limiters be cloned to create parallel instances that don't share state, bypassing global rate limits? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Struct: RateLimiter] [Capabilities] Can the store ability allow rate limiters to be transferred to malicious contracts that manipulate their state externally? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Struct: RateLimiterConfig] [Capabilities] With copy, drop, store, can configurations be duplicated and modified outside the rate_limiter module, breaking invariants? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Struct: RateLimiter] [Capabilities] Can the drop ability cause rate limiters to be accidentally destroyed, losing all accumulated rate limit state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: update_internal()] [Timing Attack] Can attackers observe pending transactions and submit their own transactions with cur_time values just before window transitions to maximize their outflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Timing Attack] By calling remaining_outflow repeatedly with incrementing cur_time values, can attackers determine the exact microsecond when window transitions occur? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [Timing Attack] Can attackers bundle multiple process_qty calls in a single transaction to bypass per-transaction rate limits? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: update_internal()] [Timing Attack] At lines 51-55, can attackers exploit the exact window boundary to submit transactions that execute just after transition, gaining fresh rate limit capacity? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Weight Calculation] At line 68-74, can the prev_weight calculation result in values greater than 1, causing prev_qty to be weighted more than it should? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Weight Calculation] If window_duration is very small (e.g., 1), can the weight calculation at line 73 cause division to produce incorrect weights due to integer precision? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Weight Calculation] At line 69-72, can the sub() operation result in a very small positive value that gets amplified when divided by window_duration? (Medium)
